history.content:
@Emerald Templeton  @Lydia Raya  @Lily Zhang  

1) If you're a double major, this requirement if automatically fulfilled. Stat courses are outside the CS major, and CS courses are outside the Stats major. Otherwise, yes EE and non-CS tech courses do count.

2) Absolutely. Use assist.org and ask for help if needed. The grade will not transfer to your UCB GPA.

3) Believe it or not, there's a chance that Summer 16 transcripts haven't been processed yet for students who aren't graduating soon. I see 3.4 units for you for De Anza. If whatever you took isn't reflected in the Fall, I would then request another transcript. 

To check L&S requirements, schedule an appointment with a College Adviser via Cal Central.
@Emerald Templeton  @Lydia Raya  @Lily Zhang

children.subject: (Until the new system gets released:) Manually, or meet with an advisor.

Following.
How do we check our progress towards college and breadth requirements?
Addendum: Can I take one CC course that fulfills both a breadth and an AC, if it's listed under both on assist?

history.content:
Hi, I'm currently an L&S CS/Stats intended student. I have three questions:

1) For the 6 units of upper division outside my major, are EE classes eligible? If not, would tech elective courses outside of EECS, like Math 110, be eligible? 

2) Am I allowed to take breadth/AC classes at community college over the summer, even if I'm already enrolled here?

3) I took an R1B and a breadth class in Summer 2016 and requested to have my transcripts sent to Berkeley; I still have the alert on CalCentral that they haven't received my transcript yet. Is there a way for me to check which degree/university requirements I've satisfied so far? Should I request to have my transcripts sent again?

Sorry for the lengthy post, and thank you in advance!
history.subject: Upper divs outside major / Breadth classes at CC over summer / Transcripts not sent
